accepted_missions.description: A series of temporal anomalies have altered the universe, merging past, present, future, and mirror timelines into one. Work with Q to investigate these anomalies, and learn how you can bring order to this chaos.
Pirates, rogue holograms, and formerly eradicated diseases are only a few of the problems plaguing this area. Handle each in turn to bring order to the region.

From renegade androids to ancient civilizations born anew, the temporal crisis has brought chaos to every corner of the galaxy. Set the standard for all Starfleet captains by dealing with each threat in turn.
Could the Federation be responsible for the temporal crisis? Captain Janeway can't confirm or deny she knows the answer, but she has sent Voyager's EMH to help investigate.
Q has volunteered to assist the Federation during this temporal crisis, but can he be trusted? Join legendary Starfleet captains of the past to seek help from other powerful beings.

The temporal crisis has brought new conflict to the already fractious Klingon Empire, where vengeance, deceit, and rebellion are the least of a captain’s worries. Respond to these distress calls before the Empire falls further into disorder.

reward.name: Chronitons
reward.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

reward.name: Chronitons
reward.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

missions.title: Ex Astris, Scientia
missions.speaker: Admiral William T. Riker
missions.description: "The Federation wouldn't exist without Starfleet. We might be stretched thin, but I'm going to personally ensure that every officer still here is held to the same high standards I hold myself."
missions.requirement: You may only use <#808080>Common and <#50AA3C>Uncommon crew with the Starfleet trait on this Cadet Challenge.

missions.title: The United Federation
missions.speaker: Admiral William T. Riker
missions.description: "I had the honor of serving with Worf, Starfleet's first Klingon recruit, and the Enterprise was all the better for it. A diverse crew is a stronger crew, as I intend to prove."
missions.requirement: You may only use <#808080>Common</color> and <#50AA3C>Uncommon</color> crew who are <#CC0000>alien</color> or <#CC0000>part alien</color> on this Cadet Challenge.

missions.title: A Certain Formality
missions.speaker: Admiral William T. Riker
missions.description: "Standards aren't just slipping in Starfleet. They're slipping all over the Federation, particularly when it comes to equality. Your crew's going to put a stop to it."
missions.requirement: You may only use <#808080>Common</color> and <#50AA3C>Uncommon</color> crew who are <#CC0000>Female</color> on this Cadet Challenge.

missions.title: Adv: A Certain Formality
missions.speaker: Admiral William T. Riker
missions.description: "Standards aren't just slipping in Starfleet. They're slipping all over the Federation, particularly when it comes to equality. Your crew's going to put a stop to it."
missions.requirement: You may only use <#5AAAFF>Rare</color> crew who are <#CC0000>Female</color> on this Cadet Challenge.

missions.title: Adv: United Federation
missions.speaker: Admiral William T. Riker
missions.description: "I had the honor of serving with Worf, Starfleet's first Klingon recruit, and the Enterprise was all the better for it. A diverse crew is a stronger crew, as I intend to prove."
missions.requirement: You may only use <#5AAAFF>Rare</color> crew who are <#CC0000>alien</color> or <#CC0000>part alien</color> on this Advanced Challenge.

pvp_divisions.name: Commander Division
pvp_divisions.description: 1 star and 2 star ships only Only <#808080>Common to <#5AAAFF>Rare crew

pvp_divisions.name: Captain Division
pvp_divisions.description: 3 star and 4 star ships only Only <#808080>Common to <#AA2DEB>Super Rare crew

crew.name: Seven in Blue
crew.flavor: After being severed from the Borg Collective, Seven of Nine--now called Seven--struggled to adapt.

crew.name: Enterprise-D Picard
crew.flavor: Captain of the legendary U.S.S. Enterprise-D, Captain Picard was key to many of the Federation's successes.

crew.name: Hugh
crew.flavor: Survivor of a Borg scout cube crash, Third of Five developed the spark of individuality and became Hugh.

crew.name: Commander Spock
crew.flavor: First Officer onboard the U.S.S. Enterprise, Lieutenant Commander Spock would become a revered member of the Federation.

crew.name: Ensign Sato
crew.flavor: Comm Officer onboard the Enterprise, Hoshi Sato's experiences led her to create a universal linguacode.

crew.name: Counselor Troi
crew.flavor: Ship's counselor on the U.S.S. Enterprise-D, her empathic abilities were invaluable to the crew.

crew.name: Commander Riker
crew.flavor: When off-duty, Commander Riker often held poker nights for his fellow bridge officers.

crew.name: Investigator Odo
crew.flavor: Odo was pressed into service by the Cardassians during the Occupation of Bajor.

crew.name: Cadet Nog
crew.flavor: Nog became the first Ferengi member of Starfleet, and was assigned to DS9 as part of his cadet field studies.

crew.name: Captain Kasidy Yates
crew.flavor: Captain of the civilian freighter 'Xhosa', Kasidy was briefly imprisoned for smuggling Maquis cargo.

crew.name: Expedition Vash
crew.flavor: A student of archaeology infamous for her ethically questionable practices.

crew.name: Security Chief Worf
crew.flavor: Security Chief for the U.S.S. Enterprise-D, he was the first Klingon to graduate from Starfleet Academy.

crew.name: Writer Jake Sisko
crew.flavor: During the Dominion occupation of Terok Nor, Jake writes articles for the Federation News Service

crew.name: Chef Neelix
crew.flavor: Chef and morale booster for the U.S.S. Voyager, Neelix was infamous for his 'even better than coffee' substitute.

crew.name: Chief O'Brien
crew.flavor: Older and wiser, Miles O'Brien would go on to finish his career as a Professor of Engineering.

crew.name: Sniper Ezri Dax
crew.flavor: Using a modified TR-116 rifle, Ezri Dax fought a sniper's duel with Lieutenant Chu'lak on Deep Space 9.

crew.name: Nurse Paris
crew.flavor: Flight Controller of the U.S.S. Voyager, he was haunted by his past in the Maquis and on the U.S.S. Exeter.

crew.name: Section 31 Reed
crew.flavor: Pushed into serving Section 31, Malcolm Reed investigated a secret Klingon program.

crew.name: Botanist Keiko
crew.flavor: A botanist and head of the Enterprise plant biology lab, Keiko later opened a school on Deep Space 9.

crew.name: Dr Phlox
crew.flavor: Chief Medical Officer of the Enterprise, Phlox was a lifelong learner of every medical art.

crew.name: Cadet Sito Jaxa
crew.flavor: While member of Nova Squadron, Sito Jaxa survived a flying accident that killed one of her fellow cadets.

crew.name: Promoted Sisko
crew.flavor: Promoted to Captain, Benjamin Sisko was recognized for his accomplishments as Commander of Deep Space Nine.

crew.name: Technician Rom
crew.flavor: Younger brother of Quark, Rom found success in Deep Space Nine's Engineering crew.

crew.name: Lt Tasha Yar
crew.flavor: Security Chief of the U.S.S. Enterprise-D. Later killed in action by an alien lifeform.

crew.name: Lt Thomas Riker
crew.flavor: Split from William Riker in a transporter accident, Thomas Riker was stranded alone for eight years.

crew.name: Cardassian Kira
crew.flavor: Kira was kidnapped and modified by the Obsidian Order in a plot to reveal the dissident Tekeny Ghemor.

crew.name: Constable Odo
crew.flavor: Chief of Security on Deep Space Nine, Odo was a constant presence onboard the station.

crew.name: Changeling Bashir
crew.flavor: A Changeling infiltrator replaced Bashir and attempted to destroy the Bajoran sun.

crew.name: Captain Dathon
crew.flavor: Picard and Dathon at El-Adrel.

crew.name: Boomer Mayweather
crew.flavor: Travis Mayweather was one of the first 'space boomers,' a person born in space.

crew.name: Maquis Takeover Torres
crew.flavor: Torres, under the control of Teero Anaydis, helped lead a Maquis revolt on the U.S.S. Voyager.

crew.name: Ensign Vorik
crew.flavor: An engineering officer aboard Voyager, Vorik was part of the team that developed the Delta Flyer.

crew.name: Martia
crew.flavor: A Chameloid prisoner of Rura Penthe, Martia attempted to sabotage Kirk and McCoy's escape in exchange for a pardon.

crew.name: Prisoner 'Bones' McCoy
crew.flavor: Sentenced to a life of hard labor on the asteroid Rura Penthe, McCoy was rescued by Kirk and Spock.

crew.name: Richard Castillo
crew.flavor: Helmsman of the Enterprise-C, Castillo assumed command after Captain Garrett was killed.

crew.name: First Goran'Agar
crew.flavor: Survivor of a crash landing, Goran'Agar was found to naturally produce the drug ketracel-white.

crew.name: Mirror T'Pol
crew.flavor: A Vulcan slave of the Terran Empire, T'Pol joins with other nonhumans in a revolt.

crew.name: Idrin
crew.flavor: Commander of a Hirogen hunting ship, Idrin captured Tuvok and Seven of Nine.

crew.name: Senator Cretak
crew.flavor: Romulan senator and representative on Deep Space 9, Cretak was the victim of a Section 31 plot keep her from power.

crew.name: Kazon Seska
crew.flavor: After leaving Voyager, Seska later joined the Kazon as consort to First Maje Culluh.

crew.name: Ensign Seska
crew.flavor: Serving on the Val Jean as a Maquis, Seska was later revealed to be a Cardassian operative disguised as a Bajoran.

crew.name: Lieutenant Commander Saru
crew.flavor: Chief Science Officer of the U.S.S. Shenzhou.

crew.name: Gilora Rejal
crew.flavor: As part of the Cardassian Science Ministry, Gilora Rejal helped design a subspace relay in the Gamma Quadrant.

crew.name: Commander Kor
crew.flavor: Kor, son of Rynar, commanded the force occupying Organia. His conflict with Kirk helped establish the Organian peace treaty.

crew.name: Commander Tucker
crew.flavor: Chief Engineer aboard the NX-01 Enterprise, Tucker remained a hands-on officer unafraid of a little elbow grease.

crew.name: Assimilated Janeway
crew.flavor: Captain Janeway allowed herself to be partially assimilated to deliver a nanovirus to the Borg.

crew.name: Tailor Garak
crew.flavor: Garak claims to be 'a simple tailor', but some aboard DS9 believe him to be much more than that.

crew.name: Keevan
crew.flavor: Survivor of a ship crash, Keevan ordered his Jem'Hadar to their deaths and then surrendered to Captain Sisko.

crew.name: Drone Seven of Nine
crew.flavor: When Annika Hansen was assimilated with her family, she became the Borg drone Seven of Nine.

crew.name: Commander Chekov
crew.flavor: In order to recrystalize the HMS Bounty's dilithium crystals, Chekov harvested gamma rays from the Navy carrier U.S.S. Enterprise.

crew.name: T'Mir
crew.flavor: Part of a Vulcan science vessel that crashed on Earth, T'Mir assumed command of the survivors.

crew.name: Third Remata'Klan
crew.flavor: A Third Jem'Hadar, he loyally followed Keevan's orders, even unto his death.

crew.name: Dr. Reyga
crew.flavor: A brilliant Ferengi scientist, Doctor Reyga invented the metphasic shield before his death.

crew.name: Lt Jadzia Dax
crew.flavor: Science Officer of Deep Space 9, Jadzia is the latest in a line of Dax symbiont hosts.

crew.name: Acting Ensign Crusher
crew.flavor: After befriending and assisting The Traveler, Wesley Crusher was field promoted to Acting Ensign.

crew.name: Koloth
crew.flavor: Commander of the Klingon vessel I.K.S Gr'oth, Koloth encountered Kirk at Deep Space Station K7.

crew.name: Security Chief Tuvok
crew.flavor: Security Chief for Captain Janeway, and former infiltrator of the Maquis ship Val Jean.

crew.name: Grand Nagus Zek
crew.flavor: As Grand Nagus of the Ferengi, Zek was the head of the Ferengi government.

crew.name: Commander Maddox
crew.flavor: A Starfleet cyberneticist, Bruce Maddox attempted to disassemble Data for study.

crew.name: Telek R'Mor
crew.flavor: Conducting research near a wormhole, Telek R'Mor agreed to carry a message from the stranded U.S.S. Voyager.

crew.name: Chief Engineer La Forge
crew.flavor: Chief Engineer of the Enterprise-D, Geordi La Forge was an important and gifted member of the crew.

crew.name: CMO 'Bones' McCoy
crew.flavor: Chief Medical Officer of the U.S.S. Enterprise, Leonard McCoy was a close friend of Captain Kirk.

crew.name: Ensign Mayweather
crew.flavor: Helmsman of the NX-01 Enterprise, Travis Mayweather would explore new worlds alongside Captain Archer.

crew.name: Commander Barak
crew.flavor: Captain of the K'tinga-class I.K.S Amar, Barak and his ship were destroyed by V'ger.

crew.name: Dr. Carol Marcus
crew.flavor: Principal scientist on Project Genesis, Doctor Marcus pursued a dream of bringing life from lifelessness.

crew.name: Weyoun Clone 4
crew.flavor: A Vorta clone who oversaw a Jem'Hadar attack ship. Later killed after eradicating a Jem'Hadar rebellion.

crew.name: First Maje Culluh
crew.flavor: First Maje of the Kazon-Nistrim, Culluh succeeded in capturing U.S.S. Voyager for a short time.

crew.name: T'Kuvma
crew.flavor: T'Kuvma sought to unify the fractious Klingon Empire against the Federation.

crew.name: Glinn Damar
crew.flavor: First seen aboard the freighter Groumall, Damar served as Dukat's second-in-command across multiple assignments.

crew.name: Lt Commander Scott
crew.flavor: An ingenious engineer of Scottish descent who never failed to pull Captain Kirk and the U.S.S. Enterprise out of danger.

crew.name: Ardra
crew.flavor: A legendary devil-figure on Ventax II, a con artist impersonated her in order to take control of the planet.

crew.name: Ensign Ro
crew.flavor: A headstrong and proud Bajoran, Ro Laren assisted Captain Picard and his crew in tracking down a group of terrorists.

crew.name: KDF Alexander
crew.flavor: Joined the Rotarran as a member of the Klingon Defense Force, against his father’s wishes.

crew.name: Marla McGivers
crew.flavor: Enterprise ship's historian, Marla assisted Khan's coup and followed him into exile on Ceti Alpha V.

crew.name: Ensign Mendon
crew.flavor: A Benzite, Mendon was instrumental in stopping a subatomic bacteria from destroying the Enterprise.

crew.name: Dr. David Marcus
crew.flavor: Son of Admiral Kirk and Doctor Carol Marcus, David died on the Genesis Planet saving Lieutenant Saavik from execution.

crew.name: Forra Gegen
crew.flavor: A Voth molecular paleontologist, Gegen learned that the saurian species had originally developed on Earth.

crew.name: Sybok
crew.flavor: A Vulcan iconoclast, Sybok embraced emotion and sought to find the paradise planet of Sha Ka Ree.

crew.name: Commando Crusher
crew.flavor: As chief medical officer of the Enterprise, Doctor Crusher participated in the Celtris III raid.

crew.name: Niners Rom
crew.flavor: Rom joined Sisko's baseball team, pinch hitting for the Niners against the Vulcan Logicians.

crew.name: The Duras Sisters
crew.flavor: The Duras sisters prosecuted a civil war to replace Gowron as Chancellor with their nephew Toral.

crew.name: Commander Kang
crew.flavor: Tricked into a confrontation with Kirk, Kang and his counterpart were forced to work together to defeat their incorporeal manipulator.

crew.name: Holodeck 3 Dr. Brahms
crew.flavor: A holographic representation of Enterprise-D warp system designer Doctor Leah Brahms.

crew.name: Morn
crew.flavor: A talkative and frequent patron of Quark's Bar, Morn was often found enjoying a drink on his bar stool.

crew.name: First Maje Haron
crew.flavor: Leader of the Kazon-Relora sect, Haron was killed when Maje Culluh beamed him into space.

crew.name: Yeoman Rand
crew.flavor: Assigned to the U.S.S. Enterprise, Yeoman Rand served faithfully in the Operations division.

crew.name: Commander Tomalak
crew.flavor: A Romulan Commander who confronted the U.S.S. Enterprise-D on several occasions.

crew.name: Vedek Winn Adami
crew.flavor: An outspoken member of the Vedek Assembly, Winn was a prominent member of the Bajoran theology.

crew.name: Mirror 'Smiley' O'Brien
crew.flavor: Leader of the Terran Rebellion, 'Smiley' O'Brien commanded the ISS Defiant against the KCA.

crew.name: Groundskeeper Boothby
crew.flavor: Groundskeeper of Starfleet Academy for decades, Boothby's advice was sought by generatinos of cadets.

crew.name: Ensign Tuvok
crew.flavor: Ensign on the U.S.S. Excelsior under Captain Sulu, Ensign Tuvok was present for the rescue of James Kirk and Leonard McCoy.

crew.name: KDF Gowron
crew.flavor: Gowron, son of M'Rel, was one of the final two challengers to succeed K'Mpec as the Klingon Chancellor.

crew.name: Young Khan
crew.flavor: Ruler of a quarter of humanity during the Eugenics Wars, Khan escaped earth on the S.S. Botany Bay.

crew.name: Defiant Commander Worf
crew.flavor: Commander of the U.S.S. Defiant, a warship that saw action against the Dominion and Borg.

crew.name: Bartender Quark
crew.flavor: Owner of Quark's Bar, he is one of the more colorful residents of Deep Space Nine.

crew.name: Ensign Ogawa
crew.flavor: Head nurse of the U.S.S. Enterprise-D, Alyssa Ogawa was essential to Doctor Crusher's medical staff.

crew.name: Duchamps
crew.flavor: After a transporter accident, Worf's image is used by a holosuite program to display Doctor Noah's henchman.

crew.name: Subcommander T'Pol
crew.flavor: Assigned to the Enterprise in the 22nd century, T'Pol was essential to many of the Enterprise's missions.

crew.name: Chief Engineer Torres
crew.flavor: A half-Klingon Maquis officer who later joined the U.S.S. Voyager as Chief Engineer.

crew.name: Recovering Spock
crew.flavor: Recovering on Vulcan, Commander Spock spent much time retraining his logical mind.

crew.name: Fencing Sulu
crew.flavor: Intoxicated by the Psi 2000 polywater, Sulu viewed himself as a musketeer onboard the U.S.S. Enterprise.

crew.name: Professor Scott
crew.flavor: Posing as 'Professor' Scott, he helped build a tank to transport humpback whales to the 24th century.

crew.name: Resistance Shakaar
crew.flavor: A part of the resistance during the Cardassian Occupation, Shakaar was later First Minister of Bajor.

crew.name: Mirror Empress Sato
crew.flavor: After taking over the Defiant in the mirror universe, Sato proclaimed herself Empress of the Terran Empire.

action.name: It's about time you came back

crew.name: Will Scarlett
crew.flavor: Forced to fill the role of Will Scarlett in Q's Robin Hood scenario, Worf was 'not a merry man'.

crew.name: Lursa Duras
crew.flavor: The elder of the Duras sisters, Lursa schemed for her family to lead the Klingon Empire.

crew.name: Talos IV Spock
crew.flavor: Prior to serving with Captain Kirk, Spock accompanied Captain Pike on an away mission to Talos IV.

crew.name: Ensign Crusher
crew.flavor: After passing the Starfleet Entrance Examination, Wesley Crusher was promoted to a full Ensign.

crew.name: CMO Bashir
crew.flavor: Second in his class at Starfleet Medical, Bashir chose to do 'frontier medicine' at Deep Space Nine.

crew.name: Dr Phlox
crew.flavor: Chief Medical Officer of the Enterprise, Phlox was a lifelong learner of every medical art.

crew.name: Comm Officer Uhura
crew.flavor: Communications Officer for the U.S.S. Enterprise, she would later be promoted to Commander on the U.S.S. Enterprise-A.

crew.name: Lieutenant Saavik
crew.flavor: A Vulcan officer assigned to the U.S.S. Enterprise, she proved herself in battle with the U.S.S. Reliant.

crew.name: Lieutenant Saavik
crew.flavor: A Vulcan officer assigned to the U.S.S. Enterprise, she proved herself in battle with the U.S.S. Reliant.

ships.name: U.S.S. Enterprise NCC-1701-D
ships.flavor: A Galaxy-class vessel famously commanded by Captain Picard. Allows for saucer separation in emergency situations.

ships.name: Galaxy Class Ship
ships.flavor: One of the largest and most powerful classes of ship in Starfleet's history.

ships.name: Borg Scout Ship
ships.flavor: A smaller version of the Collective's ubiquitous and fearsome cubical spacecraft. Features self-repairing systems.

ships.name: Klingon K'Vort Bird-of-Prey
ships.flavor: A versatile craft often used for scouting and patrolling. The K'Vort-class is the most stable iteration of this design.

ships.name: U.S.S. Enterprise NCC-1701
ships.flavor: A Constitution-class vessel made legend under the command of Captain Kirk. A hardy ship that survived many encounters.

ships.name: Constitution Class Ship
ships.flavor: The face of Starfleet in the 23rd century, these heavy cruisers were designed for long-term missions.

ships.name: Cardassian Galor Cruiser
ships.flavor: The "foot soldier" of the Cardassian Union, nimble and destructive. Features multiple phaser arrays.

ships.name: Nova Class
ships.flavor: Designed for short-term missions of science and exploration. Features advanced sensor arrays.

ships.name: U.S.S. Defiant
ships.flavor: Initially created for use against the Borg. Equipped with ablative armor and Starfleet's first legal cloaking device.

ships.name: Defiant-Class Ship
ships.flavor: Named after the initial prototype, brought into production during the Dominion War to serve as warships.

ships.name: Jem'Hadar Fighter
ships.flavor: A warship used by the soldier species of the Dominion. Equipped with phased polaron beam weapons

ships.name: Intrepid-Class Ship
ships.flavor: Designed for long-term exploration. Able to land on the surface of a planet and powered by bio-neural gel packs.

ships.name: U.S.S. Voyager
ships.flavor: A Intrepid-class vessel notable for being the first to explore the Delta Quadrant—if not by choice.

ships.name: Romulan D'deridex Warbird
ships.flavor: One of the largest and most advanced vessels in the quadrant. Utilizes a forced quantum singularity as a power source.

ships.name: Constellation Class
ships.flavor: Uniquely designed with four warp nacelles. Most often deployed for exploration and defensive patrols.

ships.name: H.M.S. Bounty
ships.flavor: A Klingon bird-of-prey commandeered by Admiral James T. Kirk. Ironically named Bounty by CMO Leonard "Bones" McCoy.

ships.name: Maquis Raider
ships.flavor: A small and manueverable ship, favored by the Maquis for quick escapes and durability under hostile pursuit.

ships.name: Val Jean
ships.flavor: A Maquis raider commanded by Chakotay. This vessel was destroyed after colliding with the Caretaker's array.

ships.name: I.S.S. Enterprise NCC-1701
ships.flavor: A Constitution-class vessel made legend under the command of Captain Kirk. A hardy ship that survived many encounters.

ships.name: D'Kora Krayton
ships.flavor: An enigmatic vessel used for battle and transport. Capable of disabling a deflector shield.

ships.name: Prakesh
ships.flavor: Gul Dukat's Galor Class vessel, famed for its service in the Klingon-Cardassian War.

ships.name: NX-Class Ship
ships.flavor: The first Starfleet ships to be equipped with warp five engines, allowing exploration beyond neighboring star systems.

ships.name: Hirogen Warship
ships.flavor: Small but heavily-armed, these vessels are equipped to allow for efficient hunting and processing of game.

ships.name: Klingon K't'inga Battlecruiser
ships.flavor: A follow up to the powerful D7 Battlecruiser, the K't'inga Class was the primary warship of the Klingon Empire in the late 23rd century.

shuttles.name: Android Guardians
shuttles.description: The Augments have shown a disturbing level of interest in the research of Doctor Noonian Soong. Convince the Klingons to guard Data and his android siblings from them.

potential_rewards.name: Klingon Empire Transmission
potential_rewards.flavor: Spent to acquire Klingon Empire faction missions.

potential_rewards.name: Credits
potential_rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

shuttles.name: Broker Trade Agreement
shuttles.description: Dopterian may be occupied by the Traditionalists, but they value latinum more than loyalty. Send a team on behalf of the Alliance to broker a trade deal with the enemy's ally.

potential_rewards.name: Ferengi Alliance Transmission
potential_rewards.flavor: Spent to acquire Ferengi Alliance faction missions.

potential_rewards.name: Credits
potential_rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

shuttles.name: Recruit for Maquis
shuttles.description: The Maquis need willing fighters, but their violent reputation and often morally questionable decisions precede them. Potential recruits would trust Starfleet officers more.

potential_rewards.name: Maquis Transmission
potential_rewards.flavor: Spent to acquire Maquis faction missions.

potential_rewards.name: Credits
potential_rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

shuttles.name: Trace Security Breach
shuttles.description: Romulan security has learned of a serious breach of top-secret Romulan data. Only a Starfleet team can be trusted to help track the culprit.

disputes.name: The Killing Syndrome
disputes.description: "The Hirogen have a point. What better prey for this race of career hunters than beings who can change into anything? Losing the war is looking like an even worse decision for the Dominion now."

intro.text: "The Hirogen have a point. What better prey for this race of career hunters than beings who can change into anything? Losing the war is looking like an even worse decision for the Dominion now."

reward.name: Weyoun
reward.flavor: A Vorta clone who oversaw a Jem'Hadar attack ship. Later killed after eradicating a Jem'Hadar rebellion.

milestones.text: "At least the Hirogen aren't hunting us? But seems like it's only a matter of time."
"The effects of astroforming haven't been fully studied.  No one should possess this technology."
"We were all strangers once—Federation, Xindi, Denobulan—but we can find common ground again."
"There's a golden opportunity here to disrupt the Dominion. I hope we took advantage of it."
"You are more intelligent than most prey. We will remember this, if we maintain our dominance."
"The Hirogen will only spare us if we do not prove a challenge. You court your own destruction by supporting them."
"The Alphas are impressed. Humanity may be a prey that cannot be overcome."
"The Hirogen have clearly stated their intentions to hunt. Your actions are illogical."
"You are no longer prey, Captain. Come join our hunt...."
"For the first time, the Treaty of Bajor feels like a good decision. The Hirogen will be crushed!"
"So many speak of the Dominion War as if it was still happening. You are more rational."
"You are a compassionate, even-handed solid. Perhaps there is hope for an alliance."
"You understand the way of things. May we die fighting to preserve the Founders!"
"You truly understand the threat the Hirogen pose. Help us engineer their self-destruction."

events.name: Triple Threat
events.description: Three strong-willed leaders have banded together to form an alternative to the Federation. Help them but watch closely—these three may not be as united as they claim….
events.rules:
— There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
— Unique Supply Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
— Using any version of Khan, K'Ehleyr, Voq, or Dukat, also Cardassians and KCA will provide a bonus to Supply Missions.
— Every Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
— Community Rewards are also available during Phase 1 only. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
— In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
— After the Event ends, look for a special opportunity to choose which crew member will be brought through the Time Portal next!
events.bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Khan, K'Ehleyr, Voq, and Dukat, and Cardassians and KCA
events.rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Supply Missions!

adventures.name: Homeland Security
adventures.description: Provide weapons and other protection for the Triad.

adventures.name: Quality of Life
adventures.description: Get the Triad colony started off with basic supplies.

adventures.name: Founding Fathers
adventures.description: Provide materials to help establish the Triad's laws.

adventures.name: The Charter
adventures.description: Find those willing to be founding members.

rewards.name: Triple Threat
rewards.flavor: Event victory points

rewards.flavor: Ruler of a quarter of humanity during the Eugenics Wars, Khan escaped earth on the S.S. Botany Bay.

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

goals.flavor: K'Ehleyr and the KCA can be trusted.

next_threshold_rewards.name: Chronitons
next_threshold_rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

screens.text: "The Federation does like half-aliens as their ambassadors, don't they? You think the human in us will make us loyal, keep the alien in check. From what I've seen of my counterpart, seems right."

"Humanity hasn't cornered the market on cooperation. I've joined together with Khan and Dukat—two of your supposed enemies—to form a new organization: The Triad. We offer an alternative to the Federation, where we work aggressively—but together—for the betterment of all."

"There's no reason why the Triad and the Federation can't coexist. If you really mean everything you say in your charter, you'll help us get started. We've already got support from the Augments, the Klingon-Cardassian Alliance, and the Cardassians. You don't want to be left in the cold, do you?"

motd.title: Triple Threat is live!
motd.text: The rerun of Triple Threat is live! Strong-willed individuals seek to form a new society outside of the Federation. Help them to establish a colony before the event ends on Monday, January 8th at Noon ET (17:00 UTC).

archetypes.name: Emory Erikson: Father of the Transporter Book
